node.title: Black Ferns deserve respect and scrutiny, instead of being patronised
node.description: Opinion - The Black Ferns were on a hiding to nothing against England. In the aftermath of that defeat there's been no examination of what went wrong, writes [Hamish Bidwell].

node.title: 'Oratory can affect the course of history': What Shakespeare's words have taught John Bell over the years
node.description: Shakespeare's work has become a secular Bible for actor and director John Bell. Over the past 60 years, it's taught him about empathy, ambition, leadership and the power of language.

node.title: 'Wellness warriors' and misinformation blamed for vaccine lag in wealthy suburbs
node.description: Some of Melbourne's richest areas are among the least vaccinated in Victoria, figures show, with the trend leaving local doctors concerned about what is to come.

node.title: Lockdowns have ended in Sydney and Melbourne so why are many businesses still struggling?
node.description: The scarcity of international students has a significant impact on hospitality and other industries in Australia, with some forced to reduce operating hours while others struggle with understaffing.

node.title: It's a 'priority' technology in Australia's net zero plan. Critics say it's a 'scam'
node.description: Part of Australia's net zero by 2050 plan is to use carbon capture and storage to help get emissions down from burning coal and gas. But is it a realistic option?

node.title: The Politics of a Sleeveless Silhouette
node.description: Michelle Obama, Kyrsten Sinema and the right to bare arms.

node.title: Internet Calls Woman Out After Eating MIL's Birthday Cake in Viral Post
node.description: The woman told her husband he was overreacting after he was upset that she stole a slice of his mother's birthday cake.

node.title: Dozens of Republican-Led States File Lawsuits Against Biden's Big-Business Vaccine Mandate
node.description: Missouri is leading one such lawsuit, which states that the mandate is "unconstitutional, unlawful, and unwise."

node.title: Cricket Australia postpones Afghanistan test until situation 'clearer'
node.description: Cricket Australia confirms they have postponed the Afghanistan test in Hobart until the situation in Afghanistan becomes "clearer".

node.title: Covid-19 detected in wastewater in Napier and Gisborne
node.description: Wastewater samples in Gisborne and Napier have tested positive for Covid-19, the Ministry of Health has confirmed.

node.title: Eric Adams Has a New Job. Many of His Constituents Don’t.
node.description: The mayor-elect will have to try to reduce the high unemployment rate.

node.title: Man Denies Kidnapping Couple While Pleading Guilty in Cocaine Trafficking Case
node.description: Police said the man kidnapped the couple and held them for ransom when a shipment of 110 pounds of cocaine did not reach its intended destination in Canada.

node.title: Witness in Kyle Rittenhouse Trial Testifies That Victim Was Belligerent But Not a Threat
node.description: Jason Lackowski testified that Joseph Rosenbaum, one of the people fatally shot, seemed to be a "babbling idiot," but not a real hazard to his safety.

node.title: Christie's is auctioning off ancient Taino items. This native group wants to stop them
node.description: "We feel it's wrong for Christie's to be auctioning off anything that belongs to our ancestors," one Taino leader said.

node.title: Greta Thunberg Says Climate Talks Are Becoming a ‘Greenwash Campaign’
node.description: Ms. Thunberg and other activists also spoke about the critical role that young women have played in pressuring world leaders to take action on climate change.

node.title: Judge Denies Bail for Trooper Charged in Death of Girl After High-Speed Chase
node.description: Eleven-year-old Monica Goods was killed in a car accident allegedly caused by New York trooper Christopher Baldner.

node.title: Ex-inmates accuse "sadistic" jailers of making them listen to "Baby Shark"
node.description: The lawsuit comes after two jail officials and their supervisor were criminally charged last year over the alleged conduct, The Associated Press reported.

node.title: Julie Green, Artist Who Memorialized Inmates’ Last Suppers, Dies at 60
node.description: For more than two decades, she rendered death row prisoners’ requests for a last meal on a series of plates, bringing a human face to capital punishment.

node.title: Persistent shortages are stunting German economic growth.
node.description: The order books in Europe’s largest economy are full, but a lack of parts and raw materials means companies are struggling to fill them.

node.title: Trump Accuses Alec Baldwin of Purposely Shooting 'Rust' Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins
node.description: "I've watched him, and he's a cuckoo bird, he's a nutjob," former President Donald Trump said of Alec Baldwin.

node.title: 'Misled By His President': Man Says He's Guilty of Being an Idiot During Jan. 6 Riot
node.description: A Colorado man who waded into the Capitol on Jan. 6 was sentenced to 90 days of home detention for his participation in the insurrection.

node.title: Wisconsin Rep. Grothman Calls Preschool 'Marxist' Amid Build Back Better Negotiations
node.description: The Republican legislator objects to the inclusion of universal preschool in President Joe Biden's plan.

node.title: Thousands protest outside COP26 to demand more climate action
node.description: Demonstrators from around the world want leaders to do more to ditch fossil fuels and cut greenhouse gas emissions.

node.title: What to Think at Work When You’re Expecting
node.description: Legal protections against pregnancy discrimination are one thing. Actual feelings of security are another.

node.title: 'Huge' Leech Creates Trail of Blood in Shocking Video Viewed 25M Times
node.description: "I was in an ATV accident & my thumb was completely severed off my hand & they reattached it & to help with the circulation they used leeches," said the TikToker.

node.title: Democrats Made It Easier to Vote in Virginia and GOP Still Won, Undermining Trump Claims
node.description: Republicans won control of Virginia's executive branch and ended Democrats' dominance of the state's legislature.
